tags: i have a lot of feels
summary: I know people want Gendrya forge s*x and while that would be hot (pun intended), it's almost too dirty (pun not intended). How I...
body:
I know people want Gendrya forge s*x and while that would be hot (pun intended), it’s almost too dirty (pun not intended).

How I kinda want it all to happen is for there to be some good flirting and a slow burn for a couple episodes. Then just one episode there’s one shot where we see Arya getting up in the morning and she’s playfully bantering with someone as she gets dressed. Then it cuts to Gendry still in bed, one arm above his head with a lazy smile on his face as he watches her.

(Arya is a deadly assassin who goes about her business stealthily and quiet. It would be nice to parallel that with her and Gendry’s relationship, where it quietly and stealthily develops away from the spotlight. This would let us know they’re happy and banging but in a cute way.)

Someone write me a fic STAT

summary: That scene where Arya sticks up for Sansa stood out to me for a very personal reason. Because what Arya is going through is very...
body:
That scene where Arya sticks up for Sansa stood out to me for a very personal reason. Because what Arya is going through is very similar to a situation I’m in right at this moment.

My older brother and I have always been close and I always likened my relationship with him to Jon and Arya. When I was a kid, especially, he was the one who shared my interests and I loved playing war games with him cause I was a tomboyish child. I ALSO have an older sister who is more feminine and has feminine interests and I used to quarrel with her more at the instance that I “wasn’t like normal girls”. If ther was an argument, I usually took my brother’s side.

But as I’ve gotten older, I’ve gotten closer to my sister. And now, my brother has this new girlfriend that my sister really does not like because of some red flags she has seen. I’m more neutral but I see both of their perspectives and I’ve seen my own red flags about the girlfriend

But, my brother always expects me to be on his side. So he tried to make my sister sound dumb and unreasonable and get me to join in on it. Because usually I would. But this time I did not allow it.

I see people saying that “Arya would never choose Sansa over Jon” or “Arya not supporting Jon and making him feel alone is bad”. But that’s what happens when you grow up. Things change. Relationships change. Everything shifts. You can’t expect things to go back to the way they are. And love? Real love? Is calling someone on their shit if you think they are wrong.

So it was my favorite scene of the episode, not just for the reunion but for the growth of the characters.

summary: Why do you find Arya's comments to Jon unsettling?
question: Why do you find Arya's comments to Jon unsettling?
answer:
Hey anon,

I think what bothered me is the “us vs. them” undertone of the comment, especially given Sansa’s behavior throughout the episode. 

If it the comment had come after the revelation of Jon’s parentage than you could take the comment as Arya letting Jon know that she still sees him as her brother. Which is what you would expect from her and would be lovely. 

However, that’s not what happened here. This is an us vs. an outside Jon has chosen to ally himself with and to fall in love with. I don’t think it’s right to force Jon to choose between his family and the woman he loves and Arya’s words ringed of a hint of that. Now, she doesn’t know what Dany means to Jon and so one would hope when she finds out she’ll understand. But I get the feeling we’re in for a lot of miscommunication. 

TTFN

summary: “Game of Thrones” - 8x01 (that I watched stressed out not out of agony for the show itself but for to finally stop being on...
body:
“Game of Thrones” - 8x01 (that I watched stressed out not out of agony for the show itself but for to finally stop being on guard to not go online and get spoiled 😛 ):

Things I liked:

1) First and foremost, how they didn’t forget anything (even if I did), e.g. Sam helping Jorah and giving them a reunion & with Daenerys which was a cute/funny scene (Sam asking pardon for the “great” crime of borrowing books 😂 ) that turned serious in the snap of fingers (also glad that they mentioned the deaths, another thing *I* had forgotten about). I also liked that Sam got upset by it and didn’t unbelievably got over it and continued to like Daenerys.

2) And, of course, the best scene of the episode (ok, I am dubbing it as such because, again, I had forgotten all about it and in the numerous of reunions I was expecting, I didn’t think of that one and it was a cool one): Jaime coming into Winterfell and Bran waiting for him!! (On hindsight, I should’ve guessed that’s who Bran meant when he said he was waiting for an old friend, when I knew that Jaime was coming, but anyway, I loved the surprise).

3) I really liked the Jon/Bran reunion, and I wasn’t expecting it to be that good. Jon’s long forehead kiss. 😊 (Sansa said that Jon’s heart would stop upon seeing Arya, but I got that from the Jon/Bran reunion not from the Arya/Jon one.)

4) ARYA DEFENDING SANSA AND LOWKEY CALLING JON OUT! 🙌  🙌

5) Theon coming for Asha and her butt-heading him first for abandoning her and then helping him up, in a getting-it-out-of-her-system-and-forgiving-him way.

6) While I’m on the Greyjoys, I liked their scene too when she let him go, him wanting to fight for the Starks (that was a nice touch too). Plus, using their motto in a clever send-off.

7) Not gonna lie, I liked Sansa’s stink-eye to Daenerys. (I like both, so I’m “taking sides” purely on who’s in the right at each instance. And, full disclosure, so far I’ve been citing Daenerys as my 2nd fave GoT character after Arya.) She has no reason to trust her, like Jon said, she doesn’t know her. Not that Jon does, but anyway… 🙄

8) I liked how they had Arya being there with the crowd when Jon & Daenerys marched to Winterfell. It’s was fitting her character, in the ways of not being ~royally~ meeting them and also being of the first ones to see them and of being undetected while she did so.

9) Sansa not having any of Jon’s insecurities or guilt trips and firmly confirming that she believes in him, she has faith in him.

10) - “Last time we spoke was at Joffrey’s wedding. Miserable affair.”
- “It had its moments.” 😎 👏

11) Daenerys smiling. (What, it deserves it’s own bullet point. 😛 )

12) Lyanna Mormont still being a fierce little thing. 💪

13) I liked how they got pretty much all the reunions (and they were, like, 8?) and revelations out of the way in just the first episode and they didn’t drag things out. I liked how they had the revelation of Jon’s parentage to him immediately and how Sam didn’t beat around the bush or stall or anything.

Things I didn’t like:

1) The teenage-y romance, it was ruining the episode and its pace and tone. It was so…beneath the episode that it ruined for me the we-all-knew-it-was-coming Jon’s dragon-ride. Plus it was so stupid to say at this point that they could stay there forever & no one would find them…I’m sorry, aren’t you the ones who claim to be the realm’s saviors from an enemy that will find you and kill you all? o_0 It just feels very off to make that comment at this specific moment (and she didn’t say it in a bad/I’m-being-nervous-about-what’s-coming joke).

2) Having Daenerys ready to threat Sansa if she doesn’t respect her. I thought Tyrion taught her a bit about patience and not taking everything with “fire and blood” and burning all bridges while doing so, leaving ruins behind. I think the writers did her a bit of disservice there. And if you add the fact that she was smug when her dragons first appeared over the crowd and frightened them, after she got told that the “Northerners don’t trust outsiders”, it depicts her in a bad light. Also, her comment about being Sansa’s queen! Em, what? When? A) You are not even sitting on the throne. B) Sansa pledged no such loyalty, her cousin who wanted your dragons (and also to bed you) did. Demanding to be a queen and not caring to be liked (as Daenerys stated) is how you become Cersei and they already have her on the throne, they don’t need another one. C) She did “offer” you the North, though, regardless. “Winterfell is yours, Your Grace”. She just didn’t fawn over you, so that’s what actually bothered you, so it was about her actually liking you.

3) Jon not registering that fact that he slept with his aunt!! Like, are they serious? They had him thinking about being betrayed by Ned, the most honourable man he met (Jon’s words), then about treason (which again speaks to honour) and not think about how there’s nothing honourable about incest??? 😒 😩 🤔

4) The fact that they had spoiled the Arya/Jon reunion in the trailer. Also, the reunion itself was a hit and miss for me. 🙁 It was the one reunion/thing I was expecting the most and it left me “meh”. It was kinda awkward. I liked Jon’s with Sansa and Bran way better, much to my surprise.

reblog.comment:
“Game of Thrones” - 8x01 (that I watched stressed out not out of agony for the show itself but for to finally stop being on guard to not go online and get spoiled 😛 ):

Things I liked:

1) First and foremost, how they didn’t forget anything (even if I did), e.g. Sam helping Jorah and giving them a reunion & with Daenerys which was a cute/funny scene (Sam asking pardon for the “great” crime of borrowing books 😂 ) that turned serious in the snap of fingers (also glad that they mentioned the deaths, another thing *I* had forgotten about). I also liked that Sam got upset by it and didn’t unbelievably got over it and continued to like Daenerys.

2) And, of course, the best scene of the episode (ok, I am dubbing it as such because, again, I had forgotten all about it and in the numerous of reunions I was expecting, I didn’t think of that one and it was a cool one): Jaime coming into Winterfell and Bran waiting for him!! (On hindsight, I should’ve guessed that’s who Bran meant when he said he was waiting for an old friend, when I knew that Jaime was coming, but anyway, I loved the surprise).

3) I really liked the Jon/Bran reunion, and I wasn’t expecting it to be that good. Jon’s long forehead kiss. 😊 (Sansa said that Jon’s heart would stop upon seeing Arya, but I got that from the Jon/Bran reunion not from the Arya/Jon one.)

4) ARYA DEFENDING SANSA AND LOWKEY CALLING JON OUT! 🙌  🙌

5) Theon coming for Asha and her butt-heading him first for abandoning her and then helping him up, in a getting-it-out-of-her-system-and-forgiving-him way.

6) While I’m on the Greyjoys, I liked their scene too when she let him go, him wanting to fight for the Starks (that was a nice touch too). Plus, using their motto in a clever send-off.

7) Not gonna lie, I liked Sansa’s stink-eye to Daenerys. (I like both, so I’m “taking sides” purely on who’s in the right at each instance. And, full disclosure, so far I’ve been citing Daenerys as my 2nd fave GoT character after Arya.) She has no reason to trust her, like Jon said, she doesn’t know her. Not that Jon does, but anyway… 🙄

8) I liked how they had Arya being there with the crowd when Jon & Daenerys marched to Winterfell. It’s was fitting her character, in the ways of not being ~royally~ meeting them and also being of the first ones to see them and of being undetected while she did so.

9) Sansa not having any of Jon’s insecurities or guilt trips and firmly confirming that she believes in him, she has faith in him.

10) - “Last time we spoke was at Joffrey’s wedding. Miserable affair.”
- “It had its moments.” 😎 👏

11) Daenerys smiling. (What, it deserves it’s own bullet point. 😛 )

12) Lyanna Mormont still being a fierce little thing. 💪

13) I liked how they got pretty much all the reunions (and they were, like, 8?) and revelations out of the way in just the first episode and they didn’t drag things out. I liked how they had the revelation of Jon’s parentage to him immediately and how Sam didn’t beat around the bush or stall or anything.

Things I didn’t like:

1) The teenage-y romance, it was ruining the episode and its pace and tone. It was so…beneath the episode that it ruined for me the we-all-knew-it-was-coming Jon’s dragon-ride. Plus it was so stupid to say at this point that they could stay there forever & no one would find them…I’m sorry, aren’t you the ones who claim to be the realm’s saviors from an enemy that will find you and kill you all? o_0 It just feels very off to make that comment at this specific moment (and she didn’t say it in a bad/I’m-being-nervous-about-what’s-coming joke).

2) Having Daenerys ready to threat Sansa if she doesn’t respect her. I thought Tyrion taught her a bit about patience and not taking everything with “fire and blood” and burning all bridges while doing so, leaving ruins behind. I think the writers did her a bit of disservice there. And if you add the fact that she was smug when her dragons first appeared over the crowd and frightened them, after she got told that the “Northerners don’t trust outsiders”, it depicts her in a bad light. Also, her comment about being Sansa’s queen! Em, what? When? A) You are not even sitting on the throne. B) Sansa pledged no such loyalty, her cousin who wanted your dragons (and also to bed you) did. Demanding to be a queen and not caring to be liked (as Daenerys stated) is how you become Cersei and they already have her on the throne, they don’t need another one. C) She did “offer” you the North, though, regardless. “Winterfell is yours, Your Grace”. She just didn’t fawn over you, so that’s what actually bothered you, so it was about her actually liking you.

3) Jon not registering that fact that he slept with his aunt!! Like, are they serious? They had him thinking about being betrayed by Ned, the most honourable man he met (Jon’s words), then about treason (which again speaks to honour) and not think about how there’s nothing honourable about incest??? 😒 😩 🤔

4) The fact that they had spoiled the Arya/Jon reunion in the trailer. Also, the reunion itself was a hit and miss for me. 🙁 It was the one reunion/thing I was expecting the most and it left me “meh”. It was kinda awkward. I liked Jon’s with Sansa and Bran way better, much to my surprise.

Plus it was so stupid to say at this point that they could stay there forever & no one would find them…I’m sorry, aren’t you the ones who claim to be the realm’s saviors from an enemy that will find you and kill you all? o_0 It just feels very off to make that comment at this specific moment (and she didn’t say it in a bad/I’m-being-nervous-about-what’s-coming joke).

I thought Tyrion taught her a bit about patience and not taking everything with “fire and blood” and burning all bridges while doing so, leaving ruins behind. I think the writers did her a bit of disservice there. And if you add the fact that she was smug when her dragons first appeared over the crowd and frightened them, after she got told that the “Northerners don’t trust outsiders”, it depicts her in a bad light. Also, her comment about being Sansa’s queen! Em, what? When? A) You are not even sitting on the throne. B) Sansa pledged no such loyalty, her cousin who wanted your dragons (and also to bed you) did. Demanding to be a queen and not caring to be liked (as Daenerys stated) is how you become Cersei and they already have her on the throne, they don’t need another one. C) She did “offer” you the North, though, regardless. “Winterfell is yours, Your Grace”. She just didn’t fawn over you, so that’s what actually bothered you, so it was about her actually liking you.

3) Jon not registering that fact that he slept with his aunt!! Like, are they serious? They had him thinking about being betrayed by Ned, the most honourable man he met (Jon’s words), then about treason (which again speaks to honour) and not think about how there’s nothing honourable about incest??? 😒 😩 🤔

4) The fact that they had spoiled the Arya/Jon reunion in the trailer. Also, the reunion itself was a hit and miss for me. 🙁 It was the one reunion/thing I was expecting the most and it left me “meh”. It was kinda awkward. I liked Jon’s with Sansa and Bran way better, much to my surprise.

blog.name: apiratecalledav
blog.title: You have a good heart. It’s super annoying.
blog.description: Hullo! I'm Av.  You're cool for looking at my blog. I'm not too active these days but it's pretty much all Harry Potter/Fantastic Beasts with a lot of The Dragon Prince, Game of Thrones, The Lord of the Rings, Downton Abbey, The Hunger Games, Girl Meets World, Avatar: The Last Airbender, The Legend of Korra and pretty much whatever else I feel like talking about.

tags: what a time to be alive
I’ll post Brienne and Jaime things in a bit so you guys can have a break ahaha
summary: Can you believe that Arya won a staring contest with someone as scary as Tywin Lannister but four seconds of Gendry looking at...
body: Can you believe that Arya won a staring contest with someone as scary as Tywin Lannister but four seconds of Gendry looking at her with heart eyes made her giggle and look at the floor.

reblog.comment: Can you believe that Arya won a staring contest with someone as scary as Tywin Lannister but four seconds of Gendry looking at her with heart eyes made her giggle and look at the floor.

trail.content_raw: Can you believe that Arya won a staring contest with someone as scary as Tywin Lannister but four seconds of Gendry looking at her with heart eyes made her giggle and look at the floor.
